intro: Matayba domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican mahogany, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly the Dominican Republic, and grows in tropical dry forests. The tree can reach heights of up to 20 meters and has a straight trunk with a smooth, greyish-brown bark. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate, with a leathery texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody pods containing seeds.
